summary: A grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) demanding preservation and production of extensive records related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including institutional count slips, logs, staff assignments, and communications, for an investigation into potential violations of federal law. The subpoena requires a custodian of records to appear before the grand jury on September 10, 2019.

keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued on August 20, 2019, targeting the Metropolitan Correctional Center for records related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054).

The subpoena demands extensive documentation including institutional count slips, 30-minute round records, TRUSCOPE entries, logs, staff assignments, training records, and all communications regarding Epstein.
The investigation concerns potential violations of federal laws including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), false statements (ยง 1001), destruction of records (ยง 1519), and aiding and abetting (ยง 2).
The MCC was instructed to preserve all responsive documents from January 1, 2019 onward and to designate a custodian of records to appear before the grand jury on September 10, 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested confidentiality, asking the MCC not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to third parties to preserve the investigation's integrity.
